title: Lebanese army command calls on protesters to open roads
text:
BEIRUT, Oct 30 (Reuters) - The Lebanese army command on Wednesday urged protesters to open blocked roads so that life could return to normal after 13 days of demonstrations that have paralysed the country.

The statement followed Saad al-Hariri's decision to resign as prime minister on Tuesday, which toppled his coalition government, satisfying one of the demands sought by protesters.

In a statement, the army command affirmed the right to peaceful protest as protected by law but said it applied "in public squares only". (Writing by Tom Perry; Editing by Clarence Fernandez)
